entry.title: beforeOpenContextMenu is not firing when right-clicking on a group header in sap.ui.table.Analytical
entry.content:
Hi,

I am using an SAPUI5 Analytical Table where grouping is implemented at one level.
When I right-click on a group header, the context menu opens with options such as Ungroup Level and Ungroup All.
Since I am using only one grouping level, I would like to hide one of these options (for example, Ungroup Level).
To achieve this, I tried using the beforeOpenContextMenu event to modify the menu items dynamically. However, this event does not trigger when right-clicking on the group header.
On the other hand, the attachColumnSelect event is triggered correctly when right-clicking on a column header (for sorting and filtering), and I am able to hide unwanted menu items there.
I expect similar behavior when right-clicking on the group header to customize that context menu as well.

Steps to Reproduce:
Use an Analytical Table (sap.ui.table.AnalyticalTable) with one-level grouping enabled.
Right-click on a column header → attachColumnSelect triggers correctly.
Right-click on a group header (e.g., “Company Code = XXXX”) → context menu appears with Ungroup Level and Ungroup All options.
Observe that the beforeOpenContextMenu event does not trigger.

Expected Behavior:
When the user right-clicks on a group header, the beforeOpenContextMenu event should trigger so that developers can modify or hide specific menu options (for example, remove Ungroup Level when only one grouping level is used).

Actual Behavior:
The context menu is displayed when right-clicking on a group header, but the beforeOpenContextMenu event is not fired.

Code Snippet Used:
const oTable = this.byId("dynamicTable");
// Works on column header right-click
oTable.attachColumnSelect((oEvent) => {
    console.log(oEvent);
});

// Not triggered on group header right-click
oTable.attachBeforeOpenContextMenu((oEvent) => {
    console.log("Context menu event triggered:", oEvent);
});

Please let me know if I am missing anything or if there is an alternative way to capture the context menu event on group headers to modify or remove menu options dynamically.

Regards,
Sridevi

entry.title: product calculation
entry.content:
Hi guys,

I'm new in SAP community and need some help and better understanding to use this chanel. We want to calculate products using transaction CK11N. But we have within the finished good also some semi finished godds with separate routing and bill. Now we have a change on routing or component on bill level. Is it normal to calculate first the semi-finished product and afterwards the finished product also or is some possibility given to calculate in one step ?

BR Rene

entry.title: ReferenceError: sap is not defined
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

our pipeline is failing with below error in the karma step 

as we are using piper template to run our pipeline we are using KarmaExecutetests step

when we are the tests in local it is running fine but when we run in the pipeline it failing with below error

Chrome Headless 139.0.0.0 (Linux 0.0.0) ERROR
info karmaExecuteTests - Uncaught ReferenceError: sap is not defined
info karmaExecuteTests - at webapp/test/unit/unitTests.qunit.js:1:1
info karmaExecuteTests -
info karmaExecuteTests - ReferenceError: sap is not defined
info karmaExecuteTests - at webapp/test/unit/unitTests.qunit.js:1:1

please find the logs for better understanding attached
below is unittest.qunit.html file
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>

<head>

	<meta http-equiv='X-UA-Compatible' content='IE=edge'>
	<meta charset="utf-8">

	<script 
		id="sap-ui-bootstrap"
		src="../../../../resources/sap-ui-core.js"
		data-sap-ui-libs="sap.m"
		data-sap-ui-resourceroots='{
			"exemptiontool.exemptiontool": "../../",
			"test/unit": "./"

				QUnit.start();
			}
		);
	</script>

</head>

<body>

	<div id="qunit-fixture"></div>
</body>

</html>

below is opa5.qunit.html

entry.title: ABAP RAP Preview not working at all
entry.content:
Hi,

I am currently learning RAP and following the training: "Build an SAP Fiori App elements using the ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model". I have done everything as instructed, but the preview is not working. I have tried both OData V2 and OData V4, but unfortunately it has not worked.

I keep getting this message: The app could not be opened...

I’m stuck at this point and would really appreciate any guidance on what might be going wrong or what else I can check.

Thanks,

entry.title: SAPUI5 application in Build Workzone with CAP Application as a proxy to the backend returns 403
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I have a scenario that seems to be quite common, but I'm failing to find why exactly the integration between the SAPUI5 and a CAP microsservice is not working. In what follows there are some details:

  • I have a CAP application with an approuter that will act as a intermediate between a simple customized table with data of things that relate to a specific customer. In the backend, there is a configuration that maps an user email with the customer that will be used. The backend itself is a OData service exposed through integration suite. This project was created with the CAP template in Business Application Studio. This part is working pretty much fine: i can access the instance of the CAP service with the approuter from a browser
  • I have a SAPUI5 application which has its own lifecycle, so it lives in a separate repository than the CAP microsservice. This application is hosted in SAP Build Workzone, standard edition, and the objective is to forward any request to the backend to the CAP Microssservice as a proxy to the backend that adds the user ID information (i.e., the email of the logged in user) seamlessly to retrieve data in the backend without the user even knowing that this is happening .

The CAP service works like a charm if I call the endpoint from the Browser:

And now, I want to be able to call this same endpoint from my SAPUi5 application that is hosted in SAP Build workzone. I have seen the documentation of Build Workzone  and went through some tutorials, but all of them shows the case when the UI is deployed altogether with the CAP service in the same repository, which unfortunately is not my case. 

I have went through a lot of blog posts and other questions that looked like a similar error was happening, but I had no luck in fixing so far.

 

Here's my understanding:

  • The CAP app has two service instances managed within its mta: gt-customer-portal-access-auth (technical name xsuaa, plan application) and gt-customer-portal-access-auth (technical name destination, plan lite). They are both binded to the approuter and to the CAP generated service, so it looks good
    below is the MTA of the CAP service:
    _schema-version: 3.3.0
    ID: gt-customer-portal-access
    version: 1.0.0
    description: "A simple CAP project."
    parameters:
      enable-parallel-deployments: true
    build-parameters:
      before-all:
        - builder: custom
          commands:
            - npm ci
            - npx cds build --production
    modules:
      - name: gt-customer-portal-access-srv
        type: nodejs
        path: gen/srv
        parameters:
          instances: 1
          buildpack: nodejs_buildpack
        build-parameters:
          builder: npm-ci
        provides:
          - name: srv-api # required by consumers of CAP services (e.g. approuter)
            properties:
              srv-url: ${default-url}
        requires:
          - name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
          - name: gt-customer-portal-access-destination

      - name: gt-customer-portal-access
        type: approuter.nodejs
        path: app/router
        parameters:
          keep-existing-routes: true
          disk-quota: 256M
          memory: 256M
        requires:
          - name: srv-api
            group: destinations
            properties:
              name: srv-api # must be used in xs-app.json as well
              url: ~{srv-url}
              forwardAuthToken: true
          - name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
          - name: gt-customer-portal-access-destination
        provides:
          - name: app-api
            properties:
              app-protocol: ${protocol}
              app-uri: ${default-uri}

    resources:
      - name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
        type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
        parameters:
          service: xsuaa
          service-plan: application
          path: ./xs-security.json
          config:
            xsappname: gt-customer-portal-access-gt-br-${space}
            tenant-mode: dedicated
            oauth2-configuration:
              redirect-uris:
                - https://*~{app-api/app-uri}/**
        requires:
          - name: app-api
      - name: gt-customer-portal-access-destination
        type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
        parameters:
          service: destination
          service-plan: lite
    in xs-security.json, I have the following: 
    {
      "xsappname": "gt-customer-portal-access-gt-br-${space}",
      "tenant-mode": "dedicated",
      "oauth2-configuration" : {
        "grant-types" : [
          "authorization_code",
          "password",
          "client_credentials",
          "refresh_token",
          "user_token"
        ]
      },
      "scopes": [
        { "name": "$XSAPPNAME.User", "description": "Default user scope" }
      ],
      "role-templates": [
        {
          "name": "UserRole",
          "description": "Default user role",
          "scope-references": ["$XSAPPNAME.User"]
        }
      ]
    }
    and I have already assigned the UserRole to my User in BTP through a new Role Collection.

    in the approuter, I have the following:

    {
      "routes": [
        {
          "source": "^/(.*)$",
          "target": "$1",
          "destination": "srv-api",
          "csrfProtection": true
        }
      ]
    }
     
  • In my SAPUI5 application, as per some of the documents i've gone through, I should bind the same XSUAA instance that is managed by the CAP Application. So the MTA of the UI5 application is as below (there are some comments as I was trying different approaches to know where exactly the problem could be). Below is the MTA.yaml file of the SAPUI5 app:
    _schema-version: "3.2"
    ID: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    description: Generated by Fiori Tools
    version: 0.0.1
    modules:
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-destination-content
    type: com.sap.application.content
    requires:
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-destination-service
    parameters:
    content-target: true
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-repo-host
    parameters:
    service-key:
    name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-repo-host-key
    - name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
    parameters:
    service-key:
    name: key
    parameters:
    content:
    instance:
    destinations:
    - Name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin_html_repo_host
    ServiceInstanceName: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-html5-service
    ServiceKeyName: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-repo-host-key
    sap.cloud.service: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    #09/11/2025 - abaixo acho que deve apontar pro camarada no CF.
    #- Name: gt-customer-portal-access-aut
    #ServiceInstanceName: gt-customer-portal-access-aut
    #ServiceKeyName: ke
    #Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchang
    #sap.cloud.service: comvendorcustomermaterialorigi
    # - Name: customer_Brasil_GT_CAP_BE
    # URL: https://fb031469trial-dev-gt-customer-portal-access.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com
    # ServiceInstanceName:
    # ServiceKeyName:
    # Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchange
    # ProxyType: Internet
    # HTML5.DynamicDestination: true
    # sap.cloud.service: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    # forwardAuthToken: true
    # - Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchange
    # Name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin_uaa
    # ServiceInstanceName: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-xsuaa-service
    # ServiceKeyName: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-uaa-key
    # sap.cloud.service: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    existing_destinations_policy: update
    build-parameters:
    no-source: true
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-app-content
    type: com.sap.application.content
    path: .
    requires:
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-repo-host
    parameters:
    content-target: true
    build-parameters:
    build-result: resources
    requires:
    - artifacts:
    - comvendorcustomermaterialorigin.zip
    name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    target-path: resources/
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    type: html5
    path: .
    build-parameters:
    build-result: dist
    builder: custom
    commands:
    - npm install
    - npm run build:cf
    supported-platforms: []
    resources:
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-destination-service
    type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
    parameters:
    config:
    HTML5Runtime_enabled: true
    init_data:
    instance:
    destinations:
    - Authentication: NoAuthentication
    Name: ui5
    ProxyType: Internet
    Type: HTTP
    URL: https://ui5.sap.com
    - Authentication: NoAuthentication #setar a destination aqui não seria necessário se vc fizer dirteto no BTP. Porém, aparentemente é uma boa prática fazer isso a partir
    #do mta
    Name: portal-clientes-credentials
    ProxyType: Internet
    Type: HTTP
    URL: https://fb031469trial-dev-get-user-email-saml.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com
    #update abaixo: após voltar o app no Workzone com 403 - ultima tentativa hoje _ 02:24 08/11/2024
    # - Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchange
    # Name: customer_Brasil_GT_CAP_BE
    # URL: https://fb031469trial-dev-gt-customer-portal-access.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com
    # Type: HTTP
    # ProxyType: Internet
    # forwardAuthToken: true
    # existing_destinations_policy: update
    version: 1.0.0
    service: destination
    service-name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-destination-service
    service-plan: lite
    - name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
    type: org.cloudfoundry.existing-service
    # parameters:
    # path: ./xs-security.json
    # service: xsuaa
    # service-name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-xsuaa-service
    # service-plan: application
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-repo-host
    type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
    parameters:
    service: html5-apps-repo
    service-name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-html5-service
    service-plan: app-host
    parameters:
    deploy_mode: html5-repo
    enable-parallel-deployments: true

  • Note that it refers to the same xsuaa service as in gt-customer-portal-access-auth.

The problem is that when I open the app in build Workzone, the medatada call for the service returns 403 forbidden without even reaching the app router (I Believe so as there is no logs in the service instance, so it's a bit odd)

Note that i have added a call to the service "whoami" as a test service that is in the CAP application and it's returning 404, and if i uncomment this part of the MTA and redeploy:

  • # - Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchange
    # Name: customer_Brasil_GT_CAP_BE
    # URL: https://fb031469trial-dev-gt-customer-portal-access.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com
    # Type: HTTP
    # ProxyType: Internet
    # forwardAuthToken: true
    # existing_destinations_policy: update

it also returns 403 now:

I am not sure exactly what needs to be done either in CAP or in the SAPUI5 setup, as it looks like the CAP setup is OK, and most of the documents/blogs says that a destination in BTP level should be enough for the Build workzone approuter to connect to the CAP service. I have this destination setup as below:

Does anyone have gone a similar requirement and managed to make it work? I'm thinking that the approuter generated with my cap app can be the culprit but i'm not sure.

I also checked mostly the capire documents (which always uses the samples of UI5 along with CAP at the same deployment) and the documentation of Build Workzone (mainly https://help.sap.com/docs/build-work-zone-standard-edition/sap-build-work-zone-standard-edition/developing-html5-applications-and-extensions?locale=en-US and other related topics), but I still had no luck on making it work. There is also a sample in https://github.com/SAP-samples/cap-sflight but it uses an approuter from the SAPUI5, which I understood that is not the case when deployng the application to SAP Build Workzone, standard edition (looks like it has its own approuter).

Really appreciate any inputs,

Erick Grilo.

entry.title: How to get a list of standard Fiori applications that are extended in the system?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We have a requirement to identify if any standard SAP Fiori applications in our system have been extended or enhanced.

Is there any  way to get a list of standard Fiori apps that have been extended in S/4HANA?

We are looking for a reliable method to check which standard apps have been customized, either on the frontend or backend side.

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: Error In EDOC_Cockpit when creating E document for France
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am implementing E Invoicing for France, have done the configuration part and posted one billing document.

When trying to open the documents in Edoc cockpit by not checking the box "not relevant", the documents are not appearing. but when check that box, its appearing.

After that when click on Create E document getting error as "relevant document not appearing in e document cockpit" error message as "edocument164".

We have also implement the badi "Edocadapter" for IS relevant.

Could anyone help to resolve the issue.

Regards,

Tarique

entry.title: SAP UI5 input control does not autofill google password manager credentials
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

In my custom sap ui5 application, I have a Simple form in a Dialog which takes user name as input and password as input

For the first time, user fills in the credentials which we can save with google password manager.

Next time when we open the app, the username and password fields are autofilled when the dialog is opened., which is expected.

Now when we try to open this app in a new tab by cross app navigation, the autofill does not work.

On focusing the password field, it shows user/password saved suggestion on click of which only password field is filled. But username needs to be entered manually.

Following is the snippet of fragment used in Dialog:

This is how it looks and autofill works in same tab:

While when same app opened in new tab, autofill does not work:

On inspecting the input field:

autocomplete is off, not sure if it makes a difference.

Any suggestions on how to make it work seamlessly if we open the app in new tab?

Thanks and Regards,

Sugandha

entry.content:

when employees come back from LOA and their managers are still in LOA, the field "manager" in job info is blank' The next level manager name is removed after the actual return date. How to make sure in this scenario that the field is populated by the next level manager?

thanks in advance for your help!

Sevda

entry.title: Fiori Elements Value Help token shows GUID instead of text for custom ValueList (CAP / OData V4)
entry.content: Hi everyone,

entry.title: J2EE_ADMIN lock with no related RFC definition
entry.content:
Hi All,
We have a NetWeaver 7.5 BW system environment with an ABAP and a Java system. The UME engine of the Java system is in the ABAP.
Since a while the J2EE_ADMIN is locked within 5 minutes by an RFC call initiated from the Java system to the ABAP. The security log in the ABAP system shows the authentication failures, and after 5 errors it causes the lock. If I stop the Java system, no further RFC call arrives, so the locking does not happen.
I have checked the RFC destinations in the Java's NetWeaver Administrator and couldn't find such an RFC destination which would use J2EE_ADMIN for authentication.
I guess it is some kind of heartbeat, because it is repeated periodically, the period time is one minute.
I would appreciate any clue which leads to the solution.
Thanks in advance,
Kalman

entry.title: Datasphere: Hiding dimensions used for filtering from the Analytic Model reporting structure
entry.content:
Hello,

In BW Queries, there is the option to filter on a characteristic which is not necessarily part of the drill-down structure of the query. In Datasphere if I choose to uncheck the dimension from the source, I cannot define a filter on it, but I also don't have (or can't find) the option to somehow exclude that from the AM reporting structure if I have a filter defined on it. Kind of how Measures can be made "Auxilary", but for Dimensions.

Here is an example:

I have 0VENDOR and MAT_SALES__0VENDOR. I would like to filter on MAT_SALES__0VENDOR, but report on 0VENDOR and remove MAT_SALES__0VENDOR from the structure to avoid confusion in reporting(not see it in the Preview, nor SAC)

Can someone confirm that this is not available and if not, please enlighten me on how it's done.

Regards,

Dimitar

entry.title: Redirect navigation to extended “Manage Central Purchase Contracts” app
entry.content:
Hello Experts, good day.

We are facing a peculiar situation and I would like to know if anyone has any ideas on how we could resolve it.

We created an extension of the standard Manage Central Purchase Contracts app. The change was developed in SAP BAS, and the deployment was successful. We also created a target mapping and a tile to use the new extended app. Up to this point, everything works fine, and all tests ran successfully.Target Mapping Inbound Navigation

However, we encountered another issue.

We noticed that a user is working with the Process Purchase Requisitions Centrally app, which includes an option to open the Manage Central Purchase Contracts app. What we need is for this navigation to open our extended app instead of the original standard one.

The problem is that we don’t know how to achieve this.
Do we need to extend the Process Purchase Requisitions Centrally app as well?
Or is there any way to adjust the target mapping or redirect the navigation without modifying that app?

We are honestly a bit lost on how this could be done, and any guidance would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks
EBZ

entry.title: Manage Sales Order (Version 2) - Custom Sales Items Table
entry.content:
We have a requirement in the Manage SO Version 2 Fiori app which is of type SAP FIori Elements and based on a V4 OData service. We have made a Custom Sales Items Table similar to the one we have in the Object Page for Sales Items for some additional functionality. This table opens in a dialog via a Custom Action Button in the Object Page.

Now, when we are adding/ updating any data in this Custom Line items table which is also binded to the Odata model, it is not getting reflected back onto the Standard Line items table without pressing Save button or reload button of browser. We have tried to programatically refresh the Odata V4 model and the list binding as well of the standard line items table but it is not giving us the latest snapshot of the data when we are in Edit mode of the page. 

Has anyone done this kind of requirement before ? Or know how to refresh the object page in edit mode ?

entry.title: How to Consume SCIM 2.0 API from SAPUI5 Application in SAP Business Application Studio?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am trying to integrate a SCIM 2.0 API (Users endpoint) into an existing SAPUI5 application running in SAP Business Application Studio. I have already configured an HTTP destination in my BTP subaccount with Basic Authentication.
However, when I try to consume this destination from the SAPUI5 app during local preview (using Fiori Tools), I repeatedly get the error: “service-destination: missing required property: type”
The BAS preview runtime does not seem to recognize or bind the destination.
I also attempted to define the destination inside xs-app.json and route /scim/ paths to the destination, but BAS still does not pick it up. Since this is a standalone SAPUI5 application, there is no runConfigurations folder or approuter module, just an xs-app.json.
Additionally, direct AJAX calls to the SCIM endpoint fail due to CORS and server-side authentication restrictions.

My question is:
Is there any supported approach to call SCIM 2.0 APIs directly from a SAPUI5 application in BAS?
If there is a way to make the destination available during local preview for standalone SAPUI5 apps, please guide me on the correct configuration.
Any insights, best practices, or examples would be greatly appreciated.
#SCIM #SCIMAPI #SAPUI5

entry.title: 'Failed to drill-down' console errors upon dynamic binding and complex visibility binding (OData V4)
entry.content:
I get these 'Failed to drill-down' errors on console even when I hide the element when it is not needed, I don't expand entity in the controller dynamically in some cases.
Is there an elegant what to avoid these console errors?
Failed to drill-down into _Guarantee, invalid segment: _Guarantee - /sap/opu/odata4/sap/zcg_guarantee_v4_srv/srvd/sap/zcg_guarantee_srv/0001/ZCG_C_SUPPLIER('1003567')?sap-client=400&$expand=_PurchaseContract($filter=PurchaseContract%20eq%20'';$expand=_BedekData($orderby=BedekStartDate%20desc)) sap.ui.model.odata.v4.lib._Cache

<HBox visible="{= !!${_PurchaseContract/0/PurchaseContract} }">
		if (this.PurchaseContract) {
			oExpand["$expand"] = `_PurchaseContract($filter=PurchaseContract eq '${this.PurchaseContract}')`;
		}

		this.getView().bindElement({
			path: `${pathSupplier}${keySupplier}`,
			parameters: oExpand,
			events: {
				change: () => this.onBindingChange(),
				dataRequested: () => {
					viewModel.setProperty("/busy", true);
				},
				dataReceived: function () {
					viewModel.setProperty("/busy", false);
				}
			}
		});
